courses.learnDescription: These classes are more traditional in structure, mostly consisting of case studies and lectures covering entrepreneurial topics or decision making
courses.practiceDescription: These classes are experiential and require students to actively develop and work on an entrepreneurial venture or specific skillset; Your efforts and work become the 'instructor' and your instructor becomes a guide to help you get the most out of your experience

programs.name: Rice Experiment Fund
programs.description: Rice Experiment Fund (rXf) offers students $100 in funding to conduct a small experiment to quickly validate a potential business idea
programs.details: Examples of past experiments include a short series of ads on a social media platform or ingredients to make a batch of product that can be tested by users
programs.applicationProcess: After completing a short application, you'll schedule a meeting to discuss your idea with a Lilie staff member. Once the meeting is complete, you'll have $100 to test your idea!

programs.name: Launchpad
programs.description: Launchpad is a guided mentorship program where you actively pursue a potential venture idea through market validation, customer research, and pitch development
programs.details: Funding is offered in 3 stages ($100, $300, $600) based on meeting certain venture milestones and making tangible progress bringing your venture to life
programs.applicationProcess: You'll complete a short application, meet with a Lilie team member, and begin to build your venture. During stage 2, you'll be matched with a seasoned expert to help guide you.

programs.name: Summer Venture Studio
programs.description: SVS is an 8-week, fulltime summer accelerator meant to pour gasoline on ventures ready to launch and make major progress over the summer
programs.details: Each team is provided with $15k in funding and is expected to be working at Lilie every day of the week -- meaning this opportunity is not compatible with a summer internship
programs.applicationProcess: Applications are extraordinarily competitive and accepted from all Rice-affiliated students, be they undergrad, graduate, or post-doctoral.

fiesta.description: The Festival of Innovation and Entrepreneurship in Science, Technology and the Arts marks the beginning of Lilie's academic year and comprise of a week-long series of events in the evenings FIESTA offers a chance to preview Lilie's programming for a year, meet our Summer Accelerator teams, and officially kick off your entrepreneurial journey

vdw.description: VDWs are a series of workshops, each of which focus on a different entrepreneurial topic or skillset Sessions are non-linear, meaning you can choose a la carte which sessions seem appealing. Missing one session will have no bearing on a future session. Sign-ups are managed through our lu.ma page, but all are welcome to attend even without signing up (except in very rare instances where the session is full)

workshops.name: Resilient Raises: Raising Money in a Tight Funding Environment
Stand & Deliver: The Ultimate Pitching Bootcamp
Legal Leg Up: Startup Structure, Incorporation & Beyond

ignitionHub.description: Ignition Hub is Lilie's start-up career fair, where students from all across campus are welcome to connect with local startups looking to hire

nrlc.description: NRLC is Lilie's flagship event of the year, where students across campus will pitch their business idea and show off their success The competition is split into 3 rounds: A virtual first round where everyone who registers will pitch, a live second round of the top 12 ventures from round 1, and a celebratory championship round with the final 5 teams Applications are due Sunday, March 1st at 11:59 PM
